Washi () is a style of paper that was first made in Japan. Washi is commonly 
made using fibers from the bark of the gampi tree, the mitsumata shrub (
Edgeworthia chrysantha), or the paper mulberry, but also can be made using 
bamboo, hemp, rice, and wheat. ... Kozogami () - Kozogami is made from
